intro: Koniga arabica, commonly known as Arabica coffee. It is a species of the genus Coffea, native to tropical Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. The plant is an evergreen shrub that produces red, fleshy berries containing two seeds, which are the coffee beans. Arabica plants thrive in high-altitude regions with cool temperatures and ample rainfall. Its leaves are dark green,革质, and elliptical in shape, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
